p.s: The sonnet Sonnet 65 by William ShakespearShakespeare was written in the elithabethanElizabethan time.
It has 14 verses with four chapters.

The first one, is from line one to line four, the second one is from line fifefive to line eight, the third one is from line nine to twelftwelve and the final cupletcouplet goes from line thirteen to line fourteen, which is very typical for Shakespear'sShakespeare's sonnets.
From line one to twelftwelve is a cross rhyme, so the last word of the first and third and of the second and fourth line of each chapter rhymrhyme each other.
Just in line thirteen and fourteen, in the final cupletcouplet is no cross rhyme an the bouthboth last words of the line rhyme each other.
This is also very typical for Shakespear'sShakespeare's sonnets.
In the first part of the sonnet, ShakespearShakespeare writes, that
